results.title: Grimm's fairy tales. Volume 1
results.brief_description: Presented by Noni Hazelhurst, each of the Grimms fairy tales is brought to life by the use of beautifully illustrated full colour drawings of both the characters and their environment. The stories told in this volume are: Cinderella (15 minutes) ; Hansel and Gretel (18 minutes) ; Rapunzel (9 minutes) ; “The Frog prince (8 minutes). Each story has been divided into its own segment so the educator can easily find stories that suit individual teaching needs. This tape is not intended to be used for entertainment only

results.title: Grim reaper. Parts 1 & 2
results.brief_description: In part 1, entitled “The True story” Professor John Dwyer of the University of New South Wales discusses the causes and effects of AIDS with a group of Year 10 to Year 12 students. In Part 2, “Education’s responsibilities” Professor Dwyer leads a discussion with a principal, teachers, health worker and school counsellor on the problems that may arise in schools because of AIDS education. An example of a successful school program is included.

results.title: Grill and oven cooking
results.brief_description: A comprehensive survey of all things dealing with the art of grilling and oven cooking of a variety of foods. Includes hints on cakes, pies and pastry. No 4 of a Cookery Series suitable for women’s groups and domestic-science classes.

results.title: Grierson Lecture 1999: Screen literacy and cultural morality in the digital era
results.brief_description:
A record of the 1999 Grierson Lecture by Lord David Putnam entitled, `Screen Literacy and Cultural Morality in the Digital Era’.

Includes:

Introduction by Jenifer Hooks Executive Director Cinemedia;
Introduction by The Honourable Mary Delahunty MP Minister for the Arts;
The Grierson Lecture
Closing remarks by Jenifer Hooks Executive Director Cinemedia;

results.title: Grierson
results.brief_description: An affectionate tribute to Dr. John Grierson, father of documentary film, who founded and led the British documentary film movement in the 30’s and who later established the National Film Board of Canada. Reveals the drive and dynamism of this Scottish-born pioneer who through his faith in the drama of everyday life and his concept of the “creative interpretation of reality” influenced many young filmmakers in his own country and abroad. Many of them appear here to talk about the Grierson they knew. Using photographs, newsreels, interviews and excerpts from Grierson’s films this documentary brings into focus the personality of this visionary and committed filmmaker. (Awards: Toronto)

results.title: Greyn - "Beckher"
results.brief_description:
This experimental music video was developed for Melbourne art-rock band, Greyn, with the assistance of the Australian Council for the Arts. A non-commercial film, it breaks down the generic film conventions of commercial music video production by not promoting the band as sexy, as rock gods, or as exceptional musicians, but by telling the story of inner balance.
The two performers, Sangeetha Jane and Daimon Barry, move through an experimental yoga/dance sequence that sees them grow and evolve over the course of a hauntingly beautiful track entitled “Beckher”.
(No title or credits)

results.title: Grey squirrel
results.brief_description: A study of the well-known grey squirrel: its habitat, its food, its habits during the four seasons, and how the young squirrel is taught to climb and to play.

results.title: Grey paddle power
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal, Michael Loftus-Hills, LoftCom and Triple A Productions
results.brief_description: This local documentary focuses on a group of elderly men and women who have embraced canoeing. Most train and belong to the suburban Fairfield Canoe Club where they thoroughly enjoy the recreation as well as the social aspect of the sport. Interviews reveal that the elderly members enjoy the physical benefits and challenges of competing, the camaraderie, and the chance to offer young people guidance.

results.title: Grey funnel line
results.creator_credit: Vincent Donovan, Brian Voce and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations
results.brief_description: Records a 1974 goodwill cruise by a RAN task force to exotic locations in Africa. Shows sailors exploring tropical Mauritius, and ancient ruins of Persepolis, and observing wildlife in Kenya’s Tsavo National Park.
